name: earth-formation
description: Our planet formed from cosmic dust and gas around the young Sun.

name: first-life
description: Single-celled organisms appeared in Earth's primordial oceans.

name: fire-mastery
description: Early humans learned to control and use fire for warmth, cooking, and protection.

name: first-humans
description: Modern humans emerged in Africa.

name: migration-out-africa
description: Modern humans began migrating out of Africa to populate the world.

name: domestication-dogs
description: Wolves were domesticated into dogs, becoming humanity's first animal companions.

name: agriculture-begins
description: Humans began cultivating crops in the Fertile Crescent, starting the Neolithic Revolution.

name: agriculture
description: Humans began farming, transforming civilization.

name: domestication-wheat
description: Wild wheat was domesticated in the Fertile Crescent, enabling agriculture.

name: domestication-horses
description: Horses were domesticated on the Eurasian steppes, revolutionizing transport and warfare.

name: wheel-invented
description: The wheel was invented in Mesopotamia, revolutionizing transportation and machinery.

name: invention-sail
description: Ancient Egyptians invented sails, enabling long-distance sea travel.

name: invention-glass
description: Ancient Mesopotamians discovered how to make glass from sand.

name: bronze-discovered
description: Humans discovered how to alloy copper and tin to create bronze tools and weapons.

name: writing-invention
description: Sumerians developed cuneiform, the first writing system.

name: iron-smelting
description: The ability to smelt iron ore transformed warfare and agriculture.

name: polynesian-expansion
description: Polynesian navigators began exploring and settling islands across the Pacific Ocean.

name: phoenician-circumnavigation
description: Phoenician sailors reportedly sailed around the entire African continent.

name: thales-eclipse
description: Thales of Miletus predicted a solar eclipse, marking a triumph of early science.

name: anaximander-world-map
description: The Greek philosopher created one of the first maps of the known world.

name: pythagoras-theorem
description: Pythagoras proved the mathematical relationship between sides of a right triangle.

name: hanno-africa
description: The Carthaginian navigator explored the west coast of Africa.

name: herodotus-histories
description: The Greek historian documented cultures and lands across the known world.

name: hippocrates-medicine
description: The Greek physician established medicine as a rational discipline.

name: alexander-india
description: Alexander the Great's conquests brought Greek knowledge to the Indian subcontinent.

name: pytheas-arctic
description: The Greek explorer sailed to Britain and possibly reached the Arctic Circle.

name: archimedes-principle
description: Archimedes discovered the principle of buoyancy while taking a bath.

name: eratosthenes-earth
description: Eratosthenes accurately calculated the circumference of the Earth using shadows.

name: hero-steam-engine
description: Hero of Alexandria invented a primitive steam engine, the aeolipile.

name: buddhism-spreads-china
description: Buddhism was officially introduced to China along the Silk Road.

name: paper-invented
description: Cai Lun standardized papermaking techniques in Han Dynasty China.

name: paper-invented-china
description: Cai Lun improved papermaking in China, revolutionizing information recording.

name: ptolemy-almagest
description: Ptolemy compiled ancient astronomical knowledge in his influential treatise.

name: compass-invented
description: Chinese inventors created the first magnetic compass for navigation.

name: printing-invented-china
description: Woodblock printing was developed in China, transforming information dissemination.

name: al-khwarizmi-algebra
description: The Persian mathematician wrote the foundational treatise on algebra.

name: gunpowder-invented
description: Chinese alchemists accidentally discovered gunpowder while seeking immortality.

name: vikings-iceland
description: Norse explorers established permanent settlements on Iceland.

name: vikings-greenland
description: Erik the Red explored and colonized Greenland.

name: viking-america
description: Leif Erikson led the first known European expedition to North America.

name: movable-type-china
description: Bi Sheng invented movable type printing in China.

name: fibonacci-arabic-numerals
description: Leonardo Fibonacci introduced Arabic numerals to Europe in his book Liber Abaci.

name: roger-bacon-scientific-method
description: The English philosopher advocated for empirical observation in science.

name: eyeglasses-invented
description: Reading glasses were invented in Italy, transforming scholarship.

name: ibn-battuta-travels
description: The Moroccan explorer began a journey covering 75,000 miles across the Islamic world.

name: tenochtitlan
description: The Aztec capital was founded on an island in Lake Texcoco.

name: zheng-he-voyages
description: The Chinese admiral began massive naval expeditions across the Indian Ocean.

name: chinese-discover-america-theory
description: Some historians claim Chinese fleets explored the Americas before Columbus.

name: gutenberg-printing
description: Johannes Gutenberg invented movable type printing, revolutionizing knowledge sharing.

name: portuguese-cape-verde
description: Portuguese explorers discovered the uninhabited Cape Verde islands.

name: dias-cape-good-hope
friendly_name: Dias Rounds Cape of Good Hope
description: Bartolomeu Dias became the first European to sail around Africa's southern tip.

name: columbus-americas
description: Christopher Columbus landed in the Caribbean, beginning European exploration of the Americas.

name: cabot-north-america
description: John Cabot explored the coast of North America for England.

name: vasco-da-gama-india
description: The Portuguese explorer found a sea route from Europe to India.

name: cabral-brazil
description: Pedro Álvares Cabral claimed Brazil for Portugal.

name: balboa-pacific
description: Vasco Núñez de Balboa became the first European to see the Pacific Ocean from the Americas.

name: ponce-de-leon-florida
description: The Spanish explorer became the first European to reach Florida.

name: cortes-meets-aztecs
description: Hernán Cortés first encountered the Aztec Empire in Mexico.

name: magellan-circumnavigation
description: Magellan's expedition completed the first voyage around the world.

name: pizarro-meets-incas
description: Francisco Pizarro first encountered the Inca Empire in Peru.

name: cartier-st-lawrence
description: Jacques Cartier explored the St. Lawrence River and claimed Canada for France.

name: de-soto-mississippi
description: Hernando de Soto became the first European to cross the Mississippi River.

name: copernicus-heliocentric
description: Nicolaus Copernicus published his theory that Earth orbits the Sun.

name: vesalius-anatomy
description: Andreas Vesalius published groundbreaking anatomical illustrations.

name: tycho-brahe-observatory
description: The Danish astronomer built Uraniborg, the most advanced observatory of his time.

name: drake-circumnavigation
description: Francis Drake completed the second circumnavigation of the world.

name: microscope-invented
description: Dutch spectacle makers invented the first compound microscope.

name: barents-arctic
description: Willem Barents explored the Arctic Ocean seeking a northeast passage.

name: dutch-reach-australia
description: Willem Janszoon became the first European to reach Australia.

name: jamestown
description: English settlers established the first permanent settlement in North America.

name: telescope-invented
description: Hans Lippershey invented the first practical telescope in the Netherlands.

name: hudson-river
description: Henry Hudson explored the river later named after him while seeking a northwest passage.

name: galileo-telescope
description: Galileo made groundbreaking astronomical observations with his telescope.

name: kepler-laws
description: Johannes Kepler discovered that planets move in elliptical orbits.

name: galileo-jupiter-moons
description: Galileo observed four moons orbiting Jupiter, supporting heliocentrism.

name: mayflower
description: The Pilgrims arrived in Massachusetts aboard the Mayflower.

name: harvey-circulation
description: William Harvey published his discovery of how blood circulates through the body.

name: tasman-australia
description: Abel Tasman became the first European to reach Tasmania and New Zealand.

name: torricelli-barometer
description: Evangelista Torricelli invented the mercury barometer to measure air pressure.

name: boyle-law
description: Robert Boyle discovered the relationship between gas pressure and volume.

name: hooke-discovers-cells
description: Robert Hooke observed cells for the first time under a microscope.

name: newton-gravity
description: Isaac Newton developed his theory of universal gravitation.

name: leeuwenhoek-bacteria
description: Antonie van Leeuwenhoek observed bacteria through his microscope.

name: great-comet-1680
description: German astronomer Gottfried Kirch discovered the Great Comet of 1680, the first comet discovered by telescope.

name: la-salle-mississippi
description: René-Robert de La Salle explored the Mississippi to its mouth.

name: newton-principia
description: Newton published his laws of motion and universal gravitation.

name: first-paper-money-americas
description: The colony of Massachusetts issued the first paper money in the Americas.

name: first-newspaper-americas
description: Publick Occurrences Both Forreign and Domestick, the first newspaper in the Americas, was published.

name: dampier-circumnavigation
description: William Dampier became the first person to circumnavigate the world three times.

name: dampier-new-britain
description: William Dampier became the first European to circumnavigate New Britain, discovering it was an island.

name: bering-strait
description: Vitus Bering proved that Asia and North America were separate continents.

name: first-synagogue-nyc
description: Shearith Israel, the first synagogue in New York City, was dedicated.

name: linnaeus-taxonomy
description: Carl Linnaeus published his system for classifying living organisms.

name: franklin-kite-experiment
description: Benjamin Franklin proved lightning is electrical with his famous kite experiment.

name: cook-australia
description: Captain James Cook mapped the east coast of Australia and claimed it for Britain.

name: oxygen-discovered
description: Joseph Priestley and Carl Wilhelm Scheele independently discovered oxygen.

name: lavoisier-oxygen
description: Antoine Lavoisier discovered oxygen's role in combustion and respiration.

name: uranus-discovered
description: William Herschel discovered the seventh planet in our solar system.

name: bounty-mutiny
description: The famous mutiny occurred during a voyage to transport breadfruit plants.

name: first-us-census
description: The first United States census was authorized by Congress.

name: vaccination-invented
description: Edward Jenner developed the first successful vaccine using cowpox.

name: rosetta-stone
description: French soldiers found the key to deciphering Egyptian hieroglyphics.

name: humboldt-south-america
description: Alexander von Humboldt began his scientific exploration of the Americas.

name: volta-battery
description: Alessandro Volta invented the first true battery, the voltaic pile.

name: dalton-atomic-theory
description: John Dalton proposed that all matter is composed of atoms.

name: lewis-clark-expedition
description: The expedition explored the American West from the Mississippi to the Pacific.

name: mungo-park-niger
description: The Scottish explorer traced the course of the Niger River in Africa.

name: electromagnetism-discovered
description: Hans Christian Ørsted discovered the relationship between electricity and magnetism.

name: antarctica-sighted
description: Russian, British, and American expeditions first sighted the Antarctic continent.

name: venus-de-milo-discovered
description: The famous ancient Greek statue Venus de Milo was discovered on the Aegean island of Milos.

name: faraday-electric-motor
description: Michael Faraday built the first device to convert electricity to motion.

name: hieroglyphics-decoded
description: Jean-François Champollion deciphered Egyptian hieroglyphics using the Rosetta Stone.

name: dinosaur-fossils
description: William Buckland described Megalosaurus, the first dinosaur to be scientifically named.

name: ohm-law
description: Georg Ohm discovered the relationship between voltage, current, and resistance.

name: darwin-beagle
description: Darwin's voyage led to his theory of evolution.

name: cell-theory
description: Schleiden and Schwann formulated the theory that all living things are made of cells.

name: joule-thermodynamics
description: James Joule established the first law of thermodynamics.

name: neptune-discovered
description: Johann Galle observed Neptune based on mathematical predictions.

name: gorillas-discovered
description: Western scientists first described gorillas from specimens found in Africa.

name: foucault-pendulum
description: Léon Foucault demonstrated Earth's rotation with his famous pendulum.

name: perry-expedition-japan
description: Commodore Perry's arrival forced Japan to end over 200 years of isolation.

name: bunsen-burner
description: Robert Bunsen invented the laboratory burner that bears his name.

name: source-of-nile
description: John Hanning Speke identified Lake Victoria as the source of the Nile.

name: burke-wills-australia
description: The ill-fated expedition crossed Australia from south to north.

name: pasteur-germ-theory
description: Louis Pasteur demonstrated that germs cause disease and fermentation.

name: pasteurization
description: Louis Pasteur developed the process to kill harmful microorganisms in food and drink.

name: maxwell-equations
description: James Clerk Maxwell unified electricity, magnetism, and light.

name: mendel-genetics
description: Gregor Mendel published his laws of inheritance from pea plant experiments.

name: periodic-table
description: Dmitri Mendeleev organized elements into the periodic table.

name: troy-discovered
description: Heinrich Schliemann excavated the legendary city of Troy in Turkey.

name: livingstone-stanley
description: Henry Morton Stanley found the missing explorer David Livingstone in Africa.

name: bell-telephone
description: Alexander Graham Bell patented the first practical telephone.

name: germ-theory
description: Louis Pasteur and Robert Koch established that microorganisms cause disease.

name: koch-tuberculosis
description: Robert Koch identified the bacterium that causes tuberculosis.

name: hertz-radio-waves
description: Heinrich Hertz proved the existence of electromagnetic radio waves.

name: nansen-arctic
description: Fridtjof Nansen attempted to reach the North Pole by drifting with ice.

name: x-rays-discovered
description: Wilhelm Röntgen discovered X-rays, revolutionizing medical imaging.

name: radioactivity-discovered
description: Henri Becquerel discovered radioactivity in uranium.

name: electron-discovered
description: J.J. Thomson discovered the electron, the first subatomic particle.

name: radium-discovered
description: Marie and Pierre Curie discovered the radioactive element radium.

name: blood-types-discovered
description: Karl Landsteiner discovered the ABO blood group system.

name: powered-flight
description: The Wright brothers achieved the first controlled, powered airplane flight.

name: special-relativity
description: Albert Einstein published his theory of special relativity.

name: north-pole-reached
description: Robert Peary claimed to be the first person to reach the North Pole.

name: machu-picchu-discovered
description: Hiram Bingham brought the ancient Inca citadel to worldwide attention.

name: atomic-nucleus
description: Ernest Rutherford discovered that atoms have a dense central nucleus.

name: south-pole-reached
description: Roald Amundsen's expedition became the first to reach the South Pole.

name: continental-drift
description: Alfred Wegener proposed that continents move over geological time.

name: bohr-atomic-model
description: Niels Bohr proposed electrons orbit the nucleus in fixed energy levels.

name: shackleton-endurance
description: Ernest Shackleton's Antarctic expedition became a legendary survival story.

name: first-scheduled-airline
description: The SPT Airboat Line became the worlds first scheduled airline using winged aircraft.

name: general-relativity
description: Albert Einstein published his theory of general relativity and gravity.

name: insulin-discovered
description: Frederick Banting and Charles Best discovered insulin, saving millions of diabetics.

name: tutankhamun-tomb
description: Howard Carter discovered the nearly intact tomb of the Egyptian pharaoh.

name: first-insulin-injection
description: Leonard Thompson became the first person injected with insulin, transforming diabetes treatment.

name: hubble-galaxies
description: Edwin Hubble proved that other galaxies exist beyond the Milky Way.

name: television-first-demonstration
description: John Logie Baird gave the first public demonstration of television.

name: goddard-liquid-rocket
description: Robert Goddard launched the first liquid-fueled rocket in Auburn, Massachusetts.

name: spirit-of-st-louis
description: Charles Lindbergh made the first solo nonstop transatlantic flight.

name: penicillin-discovered
description: Alexander Fleming discovered the first antibiotic by accident.

name: expanding-universe
description: Edwin Hubble discovered that the universe is expanding.

name: pluto-discovered
description: Clyde Tombaugh discovered Pluto at Lowell Observatory.

name: neutron-discovered
description: James Chadwick discovered the neutron in the atomic nucleus.

name: amelia-earhart-atlantic
description: Amelia Earhart became the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic.

name: first-woman-us-senator
friendly_name: First Woman Elected to US Senate
description: Hattie Caraway became the first woman elected to the United States Senate.

name: nuclear-fission
description: Otto Hahn and Fritz Strassmann discovered nuclear fission.

name: carbon-14-discovered
description: Martin Kamen and Sam Ruben discovered carbon-14, revolutionizing archaeological dating.

name: penicillin-mass-produced
description: Scientists developed methods to mass produce the life-saving antibiotic.

name: dead-sea-scrolls
description: Ancient Jewish manuscripts were found in caves near the Dead Sea.

name: heyerdahl-kon-tiki
description: Thor Heyerdahl sailed a balsa raft from South America to Polynesia.

name: dna-structure
description: Watson and Crick discovered the double helix structure of DNA.

name: everest
description: Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay became the first to summit Mount Everest.

name: georgetown-ibm-machine-translation
description: The first public demonstration of machine translation is held in New York at IBM headquarters.

name: uss-nautilus-launched
description: The first nuclear-powered submarine, USS Nautilus, is launched in Groton, Connecticut.

name: polio-vaccine
description: Jonas Salk's vaccine was declared safe and effective against polio.

name: sputnik-launched
description: The Soviet Union launched the first artificial satellite into orbit.

name: van-allen-belt-detected
description: The first successful American satellite detects the Van Allen radiation belt.

name: mariana-trench
description: Jacques Piccard and Don Walsh descended to the deepest point on Earth.

name: laser-invented
description: Theodore Maiman built the first working laser.

name: bathyscaphe-trieste
description: The bathyscaphe Trieste descended to the bottom of the Mariana Trench.

name: first-human-space
description: Yuri Gagarin became the first human to travel to outer space.

name: quasars-discovered
description: Astronomers discovered extremely bright and distant quasi-stellar objects.

name: first-woman-space
description: Soviet cosmonaut Valentina Tereshkova became the first woman to fly in space.

name: luna-9-launched
description: The Soviet Union launches the unmanned Luna 9 spacecraft to achieve first soft landing on the Moon.

name: plate-tectonics-confirmed
description: Scientists confirmed that Earth's surface is divided into moving plates.

name: apollo-5-lunar-module
description: Apollo 5 lifts off carrying the first Lunar Module into space.

name: moon-landing
description: Neil Armstrong became the first human to walk on the Moon.

name: apollo-11-launch
description: The mission that would land humans on the Moon launched from Florida.

name: boeing-747-enters-service
description: The worlds first jumbo jet enters commercial service for Pan Am from New York to London.

name: japan-launches-ohsumi
description: Japan becomes the fourth nation to put a satellite into orbit using its own booster.

name: mri-invented
description: Raymond Damadian demonstrated magnetic resonance imaging.

name: lucy-discovered
description: Donald Johanson discovered the famous Australopithecus afarensis skeleton in Ethiopia.

name: voyager-1-launched
description: NASA launched Voyager 1, now the farthest human-made object from Earth.

name: first-dna-sequencing
description: Frederick Sanger developed a method to sequence DNA, revolutionizing genetics.

name: test-tube-baby
description: Louise Brown was born as the first baby conceived through IVF.

name: smallpox-eradicated
description: The World Health Organization declared smallpox the first disease eradicated by humans.

name: hiv-identified
description: Scientists identified HIV as the virus causing AIDS.

name: titanic-wreck-found
description: Robert Ballard discovered the wreck of the Titanic on the ocean floor.

name: world-wide-web
description: Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web at CERN.

name: hubble-launch
description: NASA launched the Hubble Space Telescope into orbit.

name: first-exoplanet
description: Astronomers discovered the first planets orbiting a star outside our solar system.

name: spirit-mars-rover
description: NASAs Spirit rover landed successfully on Mars to explore the surface.

name: eris-discovery
description: Discovery of Eris led the IAU to define planet for the first time, demoting Pluto.

name: higgs-boson
description: Scientists at CERN confirmed the existence of the Higgs boson particle.

name: crispr-gene-editing
description: Scientists developed CRISPR-Cas9 as a precise gene editing tool.

name: voyager-leaves-solar-system
description: Voyager 1 became the first spacecraft to enter interstellar space.

name: mars-curiosity-landing
description: NASA's Curiosity rover landed on Mars to search for signs of life.

name: india-mars-mission
description: India became the first Asian nation to reach Mars orbit on its first attempt.

name: gravitational-waves
description: LIGO detected gravitational waves, confirming Einstein's prediction.

name: new-horizons-pluto
description: NASA's probe made the first flyby of Pluto, revealing its surface.

name: spacex-reusable-rocket
description: SpaceX successfully landed a rocket booster for reuse for the first time.

name: black-hole-image
description: The Event Horizon Telescope captured the first image of a black hole.

name: quantum-computing-supremacy
description: Google claimed quantum supremacy with its Sycamore processor.

name: change-4-landing
friendly_name: Change 4 Lands on Far Side of Moon
description: Chinas probe made the first soft landing on the far side of the Moon.

name: mrna-vaccines
description: The first mRNA vaccines were approved for COVID-19 prevention.

name: alphafold-protein
description: AI solved the 50-year-old problem of predicting protein structures.

name: china-moon-samples
description: China became the third country to return lunar samples to Earth.

name: james-webb-launched
description: NASA launched the most powerful space telescope ever built.

name: perseverance-mars-landing
description: NASA's Perseverance rover landed on Mars with the Ingenuity helicopter.

name: ingenuity-mars-flight
description: Ingenuity became the first aircraft to fly on another planet.

name: parker-solar-probe
description: The probe became the first spacecraft to fly through the Sun's corona.

name: dart-asteroid-impact
description: NASA successfully deflected an asteroid for the first time in history.

name: nuclear-fusion-ignition
description: Scientists achieved fusion ignition, producing more energy than was input.

name: superconductor-claims
description: Claims of a room-temperature superconductor sparked global scientific interest.

name: arpanet-created
description: The precursor to the internet connected its first computers at UCLA and Stanford.

name: mir-space-station
description: The Soviet Union launched the first modular space station, which operated for 15 years.

name: www-goes-public
description: Tim Berners-Lee made the World Wide Web available to the general public.

name: india-nuclear-tests
description: India conducted nuclear tests, declaring itself a nuclear weapons state.

name: anaesthesia-discovered
description: Crawford Long used ether to perform painless surgery, revolutionizing medicine.

name: first-stone-tools
description: Early hominins created the first stone tools in Africa, marking a major cognitive leap.

name: anatomically-modern-humans
description: Homo sapiens with modern anatomy appeared in Africa, distinct from earlier human species.

name: domestication-cattle
description: Cattle were domesticated in the Near East and Africa, transforming human societies.

name: copper-smelting-begins
description: Humans first extracted copper from ore, beginning the age of metallurgy.

name: zhang-heng-seismoscope
description: Chinese scientist Zhang Heng invented the first device to detect distant earthquakes.

name: homo-erectus-emerges
description: Homo erectus emerged in Africa as the first hominin species to spread beyond the continent, using fire and more advanced tools.

name: domestication-of-sheep-and-goats
description: Sheep and goats became the first livestock animals domesticated in the Fertile Crescent, providing wool, milk, and meat.

name: domestication-of-pigs
description: Pigs were domesticated independently in multiple regions including China and Anatolia, becoming a key food source.

name: domestication-of-donkeys
description: Donkeys were domesticated from African wild asses in Northeast Africa, revolutionizing overland transport and trade.

name: dionysius-exiguus-creates-ad-system
description: Scythian monk Dionysius Exiguus devised the Anno Domini dating system while calculating Easter dates in Rome.

name: buddhism-officially-introduced-to-japan
description: Korean envoys brought Buddhist scriptures and images to the Japanese court, beginning Buddhism's spread in Japan.

name: cyrillic-alphabet-created
description: Saints Cyril and Methodius developed the Glagolitic script, which evolved into Cyrillic for Slavic languages.

name: gunpowder-formula-first-recorded
description: The first written gunpowder formula appeared in the Chinese Wujing Zongyao military compendium during the Song Dynasty.

name: silver-discovered-at-potosi
description: Spanish colonizers discovered rich silver deposits at Cerro Rico in present-day Bolivia, fueling global trade.

name: spinning-jenny-invented
description: James Hargreaves invented the spinning jenny, a multi-spindle machine that revolutionized textile production.

name: hydrogen-discovered
description: Henry Cavendish isolated hydrogen gas and described its properties, calling it 'inflammable air' in his research.

name: first-voyage-of-james-cook
description: Captain James Cook departed England on HMS Endeavour to observe the Transit of Venus and explore the Pacific.

name: nitrogen-discovered
description: Scottish physician Daniel Rutherford identified nitrogen as a separate component of air, calling it 'noxious air.'

name: power-loom-invented
description: Edmund Cartwright patented the power loom, mechanizing weaving and transforming the textile industry.

name: penny-post-introduced
description: Britain introduced the Penny Post system with the first adhesive postage stamp, democratizing mail delivery.

name: garibaldis-expedition
description: Giuseppe Garibaldi led his Thousand Red Shirts to conquer Sicily and Naples, advancing Italian unification.

name: dynamite-invented
description: Alfred Nobel patented dynamite, a safer explosive using nitroglycerin absorbed in diatomaceous earth.

name: maxim-gun-invented
description: Hiram Maxim invented the first fully automatic machine gun, using recoil energy to fire continuously.

name: max-plancks-quantum-theory
description: Max Planck proposed that energy is emitted in discrete quanta, launching the quantum physics revolution.

name: general-strike-in-britain
description: British workers staged a nine-day general strike in support of coal miners facing wage cuts and longer hours.

name: heisenbergs-uncertainty-principle
description: Werner Heisenberg formulated the uncertainty principle, stating position and momentum cannot both be precisely known.

name: first-nuclear-reactor
description: Enrico Fermi achieved the first controlled nuclear chain reaction at Chicago Pile-1 beneath Stagg Field.

name: transistor-invented
description: Bell Labs scientists Bardeen, Brattain, and Shockley invented the transistor, enabling modern electronics.

name: first-soviet-nuclear-test
description: The Soviet Union detonated its first atomic bomb, codenamed 'First Lightning,' ending the American nuclear monopoly.

name: first-hydrogen-bomb-test
description: The United States detonated Ivy Mike, the first thermonuclear device, at Enewetak Atoll with a 10.4 megaton yield.

name: geneva-summit-1955
description: Leaders of the US, USSR, UK, and France met in Geneva, the first superpower summit since Potsdam in 1945.

name: laika-in-space
description: Soviet dog Laika became the first animal to orbit Earth aboard Sputnik 2, proving life could survive in space.

name: apollo-17-last-moon-mission
description: Apollo 17 was the final crewed lunar mission, with astronauts Cernan and Schmitt spending 75 hours on the Moon.

name: viking-lands-on-mars
description: NASA's Viking 1 became the first spacecraft to successfully land on Mars and transmit surface images.

name: first-space-shuttle-launch
description: Space Shuttle Columbia launched on STS-1, beginning NASA's reusable spacecraft program that flew until 2011.

name: north-korea-nuclear-test
description: North Korea conducted its first underground nuclear test, becoming the eighth country to detonate a nuclear device.

name: felix-baumgartner-space-jump
description: Austrian skydiver Felix Baumgartner jumped from 128,000 feet, breaking the sound barrier during freefall.
